meanings.definition: A drug used in the treatment of HIV/AIDS.
meanings.sent1: The doctor prescribed azidothymidine to help manage the patient's HIV.
meanings.sent2: Many people with HIV take azidothymidine as part of their treatment.
meanings.sent3: When the azidothymidine bottle started singing, everyone in the pharmacy was surprised.
meanings.sent4: The azidothymidine pill was a shield against the virus invading the body.
meanings.sent5: The red color of the azidothymidine tablets reminded the patient of their fight against HIV.

meanings.definition: A nucleoside analog reverse transcriptase inhibitor.
meanings.sent1: Scientists are studying the effects of azidothymidine on reverse transcriptase.
meanings.sent2: The mechanism of action of azidothymidine involves inhibiting reverse transcriptase.
meanings.sent3: The reverse transcriptase enzyme was confused when azidothymidine blocked its path.
meanings.sent4: Azidothymidine acted like a lock, preventing reverse transcriptase from working properly.
meanings.sent5: The laboratory was filled with excitement as azidothymidine successfully halted reverse transcriptase activity.

meanings.sent1: Patients often refer to azidothymidine as AZT for short.
meanings.sent2: The abbreviation AZT is commonly used instead of azidothymidine.
meanings.sent3: When the doctor mentioned AZT, the patient immediately recognized it as azidothymidine.
meanings.sent4: AZT, or azidothymidine, is a well-known medication for HIV/AIDS.
meanings.sent5: The pharmacy stocked up on AZT, ensuring a steady supply of azidothymidine for patients.
